boardgame.name: 100 Hobbies for Deep Spacers - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hobbies are ways to pass the time and pursue an activity or object that is a passion for the character. In deep space this can take on a slightly different angle, as the possibilities of alien worlds, cultures, and situations allow for an even greater diversity of possibility and opportunity. From enjoyable games to useful skills to fringe gigs, hobbies are open to almost everyone without the extreme skill that dedicated occupations require.

This list is intended for any deep space setting (like Star Wars, Traveler, Space Opera, Rifts, etc.) where people explore alien places and cultures as a common everyday activity. This little product gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to nearly anyone in your campaign with just a dice roll. After all, who doesn’t need a hobby? If you want occupations, please see 200 Spacer Occupations (also by D10 Dimensions).

boardgame.name: 200 Space Civilization Occupations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the deeps of space, there are hundreds of occupations that need to be filled for a functional (or dysfunctional) society. Whether your heroes live at a star port or sprawling shanty town of atmosphere shacks, the fact remains that people will always have occupations that fulfill the needs of their society.

This system-agnostic list can be applied to any community that has fully embraced space and interplanetary travel (like those found in game systems such as Star Wars, Space Opera, Traveller, Star Trek, Red Dwarf, etc.). This tool focuses on variety, and lets the Game Master define all the details of the occupation to best fit the location and the system they are using. If the person has a secondary occupation, gig, or side hustle, then we recommend that you roll a second time.

boardgame.name: 100 Activities at a Wild West Rodeo or State Fair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While rodeos are famous as exhibitions of horse skills and hard won experience, they are also place for people to eat, celebrate, share ideas, make new friends and just have fun. So, take a walk into the fairground and everything it has to offer.

This list is intended for the wild west genre of games (like Tall Tales, Boot Hill, Deadlands, etc.). This tool can be easily applied to create a state or town fair, rodeo, or other form of public celebration. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next local celebration. Entries with a “*” are competitions that reward prize money to the winner. A small fair will have 10 to 15 rolls on this table, while a large fair could have 35 to 40 of the activities described here.

boardgame.name: Lazer Ryderz: Playmat
boardgame.description: 36" x 36" Neopreme Playmat for the Lazer Ryderz game featuring thematic art

boardgame.name: Swearmints
boardgame.description:
Overview

Swearmints is a quick party game about making up new slang and defining it for your friends! Earn Mints by coming up with the best definitions!

Set Up

Start by choosing one person to be the Mint Master (or dealer) for the round.
Remove the cards from the tin and shuffle them lightly, but keep the mint cubes inside.
The Game

The Mint Master starts by dealing out 2 cards to all other players. Each card has 4 silly words on each side, so each player will have 16 words to play with.
All players must combine one word on each of their cards to form a new slang phrase and arrange it face up in front of them. (They cannot combine two words on the same card).
Once everyone is ready, each player must introduce their new slang phrase and tell the Mint Master what it means.
Scoring

After each player has defined their word, the Mint Master awards 1 Mint to their favorite new slang phrase, plus:

1 bonus Mint if that player used alliteration (two words with the same first letter, such as Boof Bucket) AND
1 bonus Mint if that player used a rhyme (such as Poot Boot).
The winner of the round may win anywhere from 1-3 mints based on their slang phrase.

Round End

Once the winner is chosen, all of the used cards are discarded, the Mint Master passes the tin clockwise, and you go back to the start. Re-shuffle as needed.
Play continues until the tin runs out of mints, and the person with the most mints wins. (If the tin has less mints then the last winner is owed, that winner gets ‘em all).
Try to incorporate your new favorite slang phrases into your everyday life!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pocket Pixel Artist
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Retro Game Jam. The annual pixel platformer design competition. Do you and your team have what it takes to design a retro game in under half an hour? well let's see you put your skills to the test!

In Pocket Pixel Artist, teams will compete against each other through a series of design challenges to see who can design and assemble the best pixel art graphics they can for a game jam submission! Against the clock, and only using small colored cubes, you must arrange them into 1 of 4 various game assets found on each card. (220 in total) if your team can correctly identify your creation you will gain points!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kaers
boardgame.description:
The Kaers sourcebook is a newly developed product by german licensee Ulisses Spiele, not a translation from original publisher FASA.

From the back of the book:

"Jahrhundertelang waren die namensgebenden Völker gezwungen in unterirdischen Kaers auszuharren, während Dämonen ihre Welt verwüsteten. Doch nicht alle dieser Zufluchten wurden nach dem Ende der Plage wieder geöffnet, um die verwüstete Außenwelt zurückzuerobern.
Abenteurer und Adepten sind unermüdlich auf der Suche, diese verlorenen Zeugen des alten Barsaive ausfindig zu machen. Manche Kaers beherbergen noch immer die Namensgeber, die im Verborgenen auf das Verschwinden der Dämonen warten, andere fielen gräulicher Verwüstung zum Opfer. Alle sind jedoch Horte vergessenen Wissens oder mächtiger Schätze, und alle sind sie für sich einzigartig.
Das Kaer-Quellenbuch bietet dir vielfältige Möglichkeiten für Abenteuer und Kampagnen:
• Ein ausführlicher Einblick in das Wesen der Kaers: Von der Konstruktion und Struktur bis zum Alltagsleben ihrer Bewohner
•Über zwei Dutzend neue Fallen, die unerwünschte Eindringlinge abhalten sollen
• Umfangreiche Tabellen, um ein neues Kaer mitsamt seiner Entstehung und Geschichte zu erschaffen.
• Detaillierte Beschreibungen von fünf verschollenen Kaers; manche noch bewohnt und versiegelt, andere Opfer tragischer Katastrophen."

(Translation:
"For centuries the Namegivers were forced to dwell in subterranian Kaers while the Horrors ravaged their world. But not all of these sanctuaries were opened after the Scourge to reclaim the devastated surface realm.

Adventurers and adepts are tirelessly searching for these lost witnesses of old Barsaive. Some Kaers still shelter Namegivers who wait in hiding for the Horrors to vanish, while others fell victim to terrible destruction. Yet all of them are hoards of forgotten knowledge or powerful treasures, and each of them is unique in its own way.

The Kaer sourcebook provedes diverse possibilities for adventures and campaigns:
• A detailed description in the nature of the Kaers, from their construction and configuration to the everyday life of their inhabitants.
• More than two dozen new traps, designed to keep unwanted intruders at bay.
• Comprehensive tables to create a Kaer's formation and history
• Detailed descriptions of five lost Kaers, some still sealed and inhabited, others victims of tragic catastrophies.")

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Protection Civile
boardgame.description:
Trivial Pursuit: Édition Protection Civile: is a French edition published on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the French Civil Protection (FNPC), a French humanitarian and first aid voluntary association.

Goal: be the first player to fill his pie-collector and go back to start position
Gameplay: move around (dice) and score points (cards)
Good/bad answers: if a player answers correctly, he/she gets to roll the dice again, if not, guess what...

Small size edition containing 330 questions / answers in 6 categories:

Paris
PSC1 (prévention et secours civiques de niveau 1 basic first aid training
Histoire - FNPC (Fédération Ntionale de Protection Civile) - French Civil Protection
PSE Certified First Responder
Mystery
Protection Civile de Paris, the association for Paris, Seine-Saint-Denis and Val-de-Marne

boardgame.name: Rhyme Antics
boardgame.description:
Players divide into teams.

The team that goes first will choose easy, intermediate, or difficult rhymes. A member of the opposing team draws a card and reads a target word corresponding to the difficulty level chosen. A timer starts (when using the app this will include a musical beat) and the team has one minute to say as many phrases as they can that end with a word that rhymes with the target word.

Points are received based on how many rhymes the team came up with and the difficulty level of the word they chose. Some specifically difficult rhymes appear on the card as bonus points, but any rhyming word is acceptable, even words not listed.

Then it is the other team's turn to do the same. Each team plays four rounds, and then the team that has the most points will be the winners.

Contents:
135 Playing Cards (Easy, Intermediate and Intellectual)
1 Scoreboard
2 Playing Card Clips
1 Microphone
1 Dry Erase Marker
1 60-Second Sand Timer

boardgame.name: Don't Judge Me
boardgame.description:
How well do your friends really know you? Read a question and see if other players can guess how YOU would answer. Questions range from provocative to ridiculous topics that will guarantee to lead to revealing stories.
Hilarious way to find out how much you know and don't know about other players. #dontjudgeme #safespace
Loaded with over 275 questions...play a card, have a conversation!

boardgame.name: Cyber City Drop In Spots V3.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Got a big map for a cyberpunk city that you need to detail? Got a thirty sided die in your dice bag that you never use? Put them both to work! This 30 Sider Roller gives you the dirt on thirty different locations to designate on that big map of yours. Each entry provides the name of business/location, a random roll for occupants (using either a 30 sided die or a 6 sider), and a descriptive that often gives clues about possible criminal activity, connections to other elements in your campaign, who owns the turf, etc. Don’t own a thirty sider but want to use this product still? Do this until you can get a thirty sider: Roll 1d6. If the roll is 1-3 then roll a 1d20 for the first twenty locations. If the 6 sider rolled 4 to 6 then roll 1d10 for locations 21 to 30. And then go buy you a thirty sider. You know you want one.

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 23
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.
Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.
